commands.name: az mobile-network sim group bulk-delete-sims
commands.summary: Bulk delete SIMs from a SIM group.
commands.syntax:
az mobile-network sim group bulk-delete-sims --sims
                                             [--ids]
                                             [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                             [--resource-group]
                                             [--sim-group-name]
                                             [--subscription]
examples: az mobile-network sim group bulk-delete-sims -g group --sim-group-name SimGroup --sims "sim01,sim02"

commands.name: az mobile-network sim group bulk-upload-sims
commands.summary: Bulk upload SIMs to a SIM group.
commands.syntax:
az mobile-network sim group bulk-upload-sims --sims
                                             [--ids]
                                             [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                             [--resource-group]
                                             [--sim-group-name]
                                             [--subscription]
examples:
az mobile-network sim group bulk-upload-sims -g rg --sim-group-name SimGroup --sims "[{name:bulk-upload-sim-01,authentication-key:00000000000000000000000000000000,operator-key-code:00000000000000000000000000000000,international-msi:0000000000},{name:bulk-upload-sim-02,authentication-key:00000000000000000000000000000001,operator-key-code:00000000000000000000000000000001,international-msi:0000000001}]"
az mobile-network sim group bulk-upload-sims -g rg --sim-group-name SimGroup --sims "[{name:bulk-upload-sim-01,authentication-key:00000000000000000000000000000000,operator-key-code:00000000000000000000000000000000,international-msi:0000000000,icc-id:00000000000000000000,device-type:camera,sim-policy:{id:/subscriptions/00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000/resourceGroups/rg/providers/Microsoft.MobileNetwork/mobileNetworks/mobile-network/simPolicies/policy01},static-ip-configuration:[{attached-data-network:{id:/subscriptions/00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000/resourceGroups/rg/providers/Microsoft.MobileNetwork/packetCoreControlPlanes/pccp01/packetCoreDataPlanes/pccp01/attachedDataNetworks/internet1},slice:{id:/subscriptions/00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000/resourceGroups/rg/providers/Microsoft.MobileNetwork/mobileNetworks/mobile-network/slices/slice01},static-ip:{ipv4-address:2.4.0.10}}]}]"

commands.name: az mobile-network sim group create
commands.syntax:
az mobile-network sim group create --name
                                   --resource-group
                                   [--encryption-key]
                                   [--identity]
                                   [--location]
                                   [--mobile-network]
                                   [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                   [--tags]
examples: az mobile-network sim group create -n sim-group-name -g rg --mobile-network "{id:mobile-network-id}"

commands.name: az mobile-network sim group delete
commands.syntax:
az mobile-network sim group delete [--ids]
                                   [--name]
                                   [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                   [--resource-group]
                                   [--subscription]
                                   [--yes]
examples: az mobile-network sim group delete -n sim-group-name -g rg -y

commands.name: az mobile-network sim group list
commands.summary: List all the SIM groups in a subscription.
examples: az mobile-network sim group list -g rg

commands.name: az mobile-network sim group show
commands.summary: Get information about the specified SIM group.
examples: az mobile-network sim group show -n sim-group-name -g rg

commands.name: az mobile-network sim group update
commands.syntax:
az mobile-network sim group update [--add]
                                   [--encryption-key]
                                   [--force-string {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                   [--identity]
                                   [--ids]
                                   [--mobile-network]
                                   [--name]
                                   [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                   [--remove]
                                   [--resource-group]
                                   [--set]
                                   [--subscription]
                                   [--tags]
examples: az mobile-network sim group update -n sim-group-name -g rg --tags "{tag:test,tag2:test2}"

commands.name: az mobile-network sim group wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
